description.p: Those who follow the Way of Secrets are erudite sages who hold great knowledge and hidden truths. These monks seek to expand their understanding of themselves and the world around them, keeping such secrets from the hands of those that would misuse them. They utilize the hidden techniques and martial practices they have unearthed from teachings long-forgotten to protect the secrets they hold.
Despite their boundless knowledge, Monks of the Way of Secrets appear as little more than ascetic hermits to most, but a sharp, well-learned soul can spot a wizened stare in their eyes.

sheet.description: Those who follow the Way of Secrets are erudite sages who hold great knowledge and hidden truths.

description.p: You have uncovered secretive lore about yourself and the world around you. You gain proficiency in two skills or tools of your choice.
Additionally, you can use Wisdom, instead of Intelligence, for your Intelligence ability checks.
When you reach 10th level, you gain proficiency in two more skills or tools of your choice.

sheet.description: You can use Wisdom, instead of Intelligence, for your Intelligence ability checks.

description.p: Through mystical meditation, you have uncovered secretive lore about yourself and the world around you. Whenever you complete a long rest, you may focus your mind on one of the following secrets, gaining its benefits until you change which secret you focus on, or until you die.
The secrets and their effects are as follows:
Secrets of the Body. Whenever you hit a creature with two attacks granted by your Flurry of Blows feature on a turn, you regain hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier + your monk level.

Secrets of the Mind. The first time you miss a creature with an attack granted by your Flurry of Blows feature on a turn, you may roll and add your Martial Arts die to the result, potentially turning the miss into a hit.

Secrets of the Soul. The first time you hit a creature with an attack granted by your Flurry of Blows feature on a turn, the target suffers disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.
Additionally, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn, instead of making any attacks as a part of that action, you may instead change which secret you are currently focusing on.

description.p: You can focus your strikes on hidden pressure points to shatter the focus and instincts of your enemies. You score a critical hit with unarmed strikes and monk weapon attacks on a roll of 19 or 20.

Additionally, whenever you score a critical hit with an unarmed strike or a monk weapon, the target of the attack suffers a penalty to AC equal to your Wisdom modifier until the end of your next turn.

Additionally, whenever you score a critical hit with an unarmed strike or a monk weapon, the target of the attack suffers a -{{wisdom:modifier}} penalty to AC until the end of your next turn.

description.p: You can use your ki to read the past from touch alone. As an action, you touch a creature or an object and expend a ki point, gaining the corresponding benefits:

Creature. If the target is unwilling, it can attempt a Charisma saving throw, avoiding the effect on a success. Otherwise, you learn a number of the following pieces of information about the target that you choose, up to your Wisdom modifier.

ul.li: Its species, including its subrace or creature tags, if it has one.
If it performed an act you choose in the last 24 hours, such as visiting a specific location, interacting with a specific creature, or engaging in combat. You may choose this option more than once.

description.p: Object. You learn a number of the following pieces of information about the target that you choose, up to your Wisdom modifier.

ul.li: Its name or what it’s referred to as. For example, discovering the name of a magical weapon, or the term used to describe a strange device.
A mental image that displays the last creature to hold the object within the past 24 hours.

The most significant event that occurred within 20 feet of the object within the past hour. The events you perceive unfold from the object’s perspective. You see and hear such events as if you were there, but can’t use other senses. You may choose this option multiple times, seeing the next most significant event that occurred for each time you chose this option.

description.p: Your understanding of the ancient truths has deepened. The options granted by your Secret Techniques feature improve in the following ways:
Secrets of the Body. You instead regain hit points the first time you hit a creature with an attack granted by your Flurry of Blows feature.
Secrets of the Mind. You may instead add your Martial Arts die to any attack roll made as a part of your Flurry of Blows feature.
Secrets of the Soul. The target also suffers disadvantage on the next saving throw it makes before the end of your next turn.

description.p: The secrets of the multiverse speak to you, allowing you to live and fight with the wisdom of the ages. You add your Wisdom modifier to ability checks and the damage rolls of unarmed strikes made as a part of your Flurry of Blows feature.
Additionally, whenever you score a critical hit with an unarmed strike or monk weapon attack, you regain one expended ki point.
